item.title: Stop Treating Your AI Like a Chatbot: The 4 MCP Tools That Gave My Agent a Brain
item.description: Explores the limitations of using LLMs as simple chatbots and introduces the Model-Context-Protocol (MCP), detailing four essential tools that provide context, planning, and memory to transform AI into a powerful, autonomous engineering partner.

item.title: How to make your agent smart as openclaw
item.description: Provides a practical guide to implementing a persistent memory system for AI coding agents, advocating for a simplified, file-based approach with a manual ‘/save’ command to capture session context, delivering most of the value with minimal complexity.

item.title: Why This OpenClaw Exploded in a Week
item.description: Analyzes the viral success of OpenClaw, an open-source AI assistant that operates locally with OS-level execution, exploring its key innovations like proactive tasks and a decentralized skill ecosystem, while also highlighting its significant security implications.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide to Starting Open Source in the AI Era
item.description: A strategic guide for developers on how to start contributing to open source, from finding the right project and understanding contribution guidelines to making impactful first contributions and leveraging AI tools.
